intro: Endotropis smithii, commonly known as the Smith's endotropis, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to deep purple. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture, while its flowers are adapted for pollination by specific insect species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Endotropis smithii is considered a vulnerable species in conservation efforts.
